admin_service package

Submodules

admin_service.admin module

admin_service.admin.authenticate()[source]

Authenticate an admin.

Parameters:

request (flask.Request) – HTTP request containing ‘username’ and ‘password’ in JSON, defaults to None

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 400 if bad request, 401 if unauthorized, 500 for server error

Returns:

JSON containing the authentication token

Return type:

flask.Response

admin_service.admin.create_admin()[source]

Create a new admin.

Parameters:

request (flask.Request) – HTTP request containing ‘username’ and ‘password’ in JSON, defaults to None

Raises:

  • jwt.ExpiredSignatureError – If the token has expired

  • jwt.InvalidTokenError – If the token is invalid

  • werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 403 if unauthorized or token issues, 400 for bad request, 500 for server error

Returns:

JSON representation of the created admin

Return type:

flask.Response

admin_service.admin.get_admin(admin_id)[source]

Get an admin by their ID.

Parameters:

admin_id (int) – The ID of the admin

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 404 if admin not found, 500 for server error

Returns:

JSON representation of the admin

Return type:

flask.Response

admin_service.models module

class admin_service.models.Admin(username, password)[source]

Bases: Model

The Admin object represents an admin user in the system.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username of the admin

  • password (str) – The password for the admin account (hashed for storage)

Variables:

  • admin_id (int) – The unique identifier for the admin

  • username (str) – The username of the admin

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password of the admin

Bases: Schema

The AdminSchema object is used for serializing and deserializing admin data.

Variables:

Meta.fields (tuple) – The fields to include in the schema (‘admin_id’ and ‘username’)
